name: Hotel a La Commedia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stunningly gorgeous hotel! Great location, not far from St Marks Square, but far enough away to provide a great nights sleep. Rooms are large, spotless, updated, and luxurious. Staff was extremely friendly and breakfast was excellent! We would stay there again on our next trip to Venice!!
reviews.title: 5 Star!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the nicest room we had in Italy. The suite was spacious and modern. The room was beautifully decorated and spotless. It included all of the ammenities we had missed in other hotels in Italy. The staff were excellent and extremely professional. The roof top terrace is a great place to have a drink and relax after fighting the crowds of Venice. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first trip to Venice and following research on Tripadvisor, decided that this was the hotel for us. We were not disappointed.Fantastic location just 2 minutes from Rialto Bridge and about 10 from St Marks square. We were in a junior suite. The standard of fixtures and fittings was excellent. Bathroom had excellent shower, bath, b-day, and all beautifully tiled; it had a really clean feel to it. We took our own travel kettle as we like a hot drink when we first wake up in the morning, and the mini-bar fridge was perfect for storing our own milk in.
reviews.title: Perfect - La Commedia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The double bed was a little on the hard side for us, but this is more a matter of personal preference. A room safe was available and the wardrobe was spacious and well lit with sufficient clothes hangars for the 2 of us. There were 2 televisions in the suite, with satellite channels and although the in room menu suggested that BBC was available, it was not and we had to make do with the American CNN.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The standard of cleaning in the room was excellent.
reviews.title: you can't go wrong
Fantastic and truly memorable experience!
reviews.text: The Hotel A La Commedia made our recent stay in Venice a truly memorable and special one!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel’s location and facilities were excellent, and all staff extremely pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 'standard' double room was more like a mini-suite - the quality of the decor and fixtures/fittings in the bedroom & bathroom was superb! We especially appreciated the excellent maid service, and were delighted to find the chocolates on our pillows on the 1st night of our stay! A lovely ‘extra’ touch!
reviews.title: wonderful
I doubt the management at this hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast was also delicious with an extremely extensive range of choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would not hesitate to book again in the future, and have recommended highly to friends and family.
reviews.title: Magical Weekend
Faultless Hotel in an Ideal Location!
reviews.text: Hotel A La Commedia is an absolute "find". The location is excellent, close to the Rialto, but quietly tucked away from the main thoroughfare. The rooms and public areas are spotlessly clean and appointed with state-of-the-art comforts. All staff were friendly and attentive, with a refreshing attention to detail. We requested a balcony and were given a room with two!

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: We will unquestionably want to stay at the A La Commedia on our next trip to Venice. My only worry is that, by then, this hotel will have become so popular we can't get a reservation!

reviews.title: Absolute Magic
reviews.text: I just wanted to say thank you for making our stay a most enjoyable experience, from the moment we arrived nothing was to much trouble. The room was excellent and the standard of the hotel was superb. And it was the perfect location to move around the city. If we come back to your great city I will be sure to book this hotel again. All your staff were a credit to you. Once again thank you.

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay & Location
reviews.text: This hotel is a real dream. The building and everything in it is gorgeous, and the staff are absolutely first class. Our stay was flawless and the whole ambiance of the hotel was wonderful. I'd go back there in a heartbeat, as there was everything you could possibly ask of a stay in such a romantic city.

reviews.title: Unbelieveable!
reviews.text: We just returned from a 10 day trip to Venice, Rome and Florence. La Commedia was the perfect spot to start our vacation. The hotel is conveniently located a short stroll from the Rialto, San Marco and other areas. There was an ATM, pastry and small market (water, cola, etc) a few steps from the entrance.

reviews.title: A dream Hotel in the perfect location
reviews.text: I am a regular visitor to Venice and visit at least 3 times a year, I have just returned from a 4 day visit with my sister, we stayed in a hotel which was new to us. Hotel a la Commedia, perfect in every way, rooms were modern with a traditional twist, spotless and clean and a bathroom to die for. Location was spot on also, just off the Campo San Luca 5 mins walk to Rialto Bridge and 10 mins from San Marco. It is situated in a quite little corner, away from the noisy alley ways. Breakfast was superb, everything you could wish for, and served in a smart breakfast room with pleasant staff. We had drinks in the bar also served by smart and efficient staff, and the prices were not extortionate. The bar was furnished with comfortable chairs and was beautifully decorated, with flowers and christmas floral bowls. I could have sat there all evening. Reception staff were excellent, helpful,polite but also very friendly. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. I have already booked to go again and take my husband for a special birthday treat. Looking forward to the next visit. My last and final comment is that I cannot praise it enough !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: best hotel for service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned to Belfast after spending 4 nights in your beautiful hotel and would like to thankyou for a most enjoyable stay.Your hotel was excellent and the staff so very helpful and courteous. It's location was also a big bonus.
reviews.title: 4 nights in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Venice is so very beautiful and it's history is fascinating, no doubt I will return one day and will certainly stay in A La Commedia again!
reviews.title: TOO NOISY!! UNRESPONSIVE MANAGEMENT
Chic and sophisticated
reviews.text: Regards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location for most sites. Staff very willing to assist. Emanuele especially so. Breakfast plentiful. Rooms extremely comfortable and maintained to a very high standard. Only criticism was that the reception booked four water taxis to take ten people to the airport for the same flight, said that it was impossible for them to change from four taxis as they had already booked them, as the fare to the airport was 110 euros, we thought it could have been made much less pricey to share.
reviews.title: Venice 2007

likes.disliked: — No tea making facilities in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great hotel. Rooms very luxurious. Great location. Lovely buffet breakfast. Staff all friendly and helpful. View of a wall from our room but very quiet and we weren't expecting any views anyway.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Liked the flat screen tv but agree with previous comment that would have liked the dvd film to change during the week(not that we were in much to watch tv)
reviews.title: Location & Hospitality
A hidden gem
reviews.text: Also agree that coffee in St Marks square expensive but worth it!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Receptionist booked us on to a gondola ride with 3 other people for 25 euros each which saved us having to haggle with the gondoliers.
reviews.title: Stay here at your own risk!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked 3 nights with the hotel after reading the reviews in Tripadvisor. We weren't disappointed as the hotel is lovely and in a great location. Our room was quiet with good soundproofing on the windows. The staff were all excellent and spoke very good English (and by all accounts several other languages!) The room was very plush and the bathroom was beautiful. We requested a quiet high room away from the lifts and got that. We would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: A La Commedia - A fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very nice hotel in a great location. There were three of us staying in a junior suite. We stayed for 5 nights and couldn't have asked for a better stay.
reviews.title: Great Venetian Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The men at the front desk were so accomodating and friendly. While one female breakfast room was on the grumpy side, the young man who worked there was wonderful. When he came across us on the rooftop one afternoon, he immediately went and got out pads for the lounge chairs and asked if we would like blankets and pillows for a nap.
reviews.title: Perfect location, nice hotel, bad beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: Yes, the beds were on the stiff side (but after our stay in Paris, they actually seemed pretty comfortable). I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: This hotel is well located and quiet with lovely bathrooms, very clean and nice rooms. Beds and pillows were like boards, however, and I was glad we were only there for 2 nights.
reviews.title: Fantastic, fantastic, fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has an amazing location and provides exceptional service. We spent a week here for our honeymoon and its the perfect location from which to explore Venice. The new roof terrace and bar is a gem - with seating/loungers in a beautiful setting (see photos). Go the third weekend in july and experience the Il Redentore fireworks - a 40 minute display fired from the Grand Canal!
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon

likes.liked: — Very helpful staff and great location!
likes.disliked: — Two single mattresses on double bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Downsides - we stayed in a standard room which was two single mattresses pushed together and there was no tea and coffee making facilities available. Cost of water taxis from the airport have gone up to 95euros so be prepared to haggle! We had a lovely stay here and would recommend you look no further in choosing a hotel to stay whilst in Venice!
reviews.title: Nothing short of spectacular!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is possibly the best city centre hotel that my wife and I have stayed in. We stayed for three nights on our honeymmon and wished we had stayed longer before heading off to Rome and Amalfi.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The location is excellent, a mere stones throw from the Rialto and a pleasant walk from St.Mark's square. The staff were exceptional and the room fixtures and fittings were first class.
reviews.title: Fabulous roof top terrace

likes.disliked: — No restaurant and small bar area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: What made the stay was the stunning roof terrace which has beautiful ambiance and great service. The feeling, as you sip your Bellini, is that you're on a private roof terrace as the terrace is sp spaced out that you're not crowded in with other guests.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in a perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Loved this small intimate, very stylish Hotel. Was situated in a perfect position near the Rialto bridge, so close to everything. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful, sent us to a delightful nearby trattoria, Paridiso, took a great interest in us, what we were doing and going. The breakfast was excellent, and the lovely roof garden and bar added to the atmosphere. The rooms are lovely, a very stylish and comfotable and most welcoming stay. Would very much recommend. Thank you all at La Commedia you made our stay in Venice !
reviews.title: Loved and appreciated the La Commedia on my first visit to Venice

likes.liked: — comfort, spotless, beautiful fabric selections, quality fabrics, so stylish....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself & my new husband stayed here for our honeymoon from 13th Sept 2008 for 1 week. We had just had a week in Lake Garda (where we got married) staying in a supposedly 5 star hotel. I have to say that A La Commedia was soooo much better than our hotel in Lake Garda. From the moment we arrived we were treated really well, it helped that our room had been upgraded for our honeymoon and that they brought us a complimentary bottle of Prosecco, but the staff were friendly & helpful at all times. The hotel was in a fantastic location & it was great to be able to pop back during the day to drop off shopping or sit on our balcony watching Venice go by. The roof terrace is beautiful, peaceful, stylish & does a mean Bellini cocktail. I cannot praise this hotel enough & we will definitely be returning in the future to celebrate our anniversary.
reviews.title: Pefecto!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very well-run hotel. Everything is in good order and goes smoothly. Efficient, polite staff, clean and well-furnished rooms, both public and bedrooms. The hotel is close to Rialto bridge, with a vaporetto stop and also airport boat terminal. In the other direction, it is 10 minutes stroll to St Marks square, past some interesting shops. Rooms on 4th floor best, particularly 404.
reviews.title: Great position

likes.liked: — Position, staff, comfort and roof top terrace.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a genuine Venice experience, you might not be happy here. The hotel could be anywhere, so if you would like to be in an old Venetian palace, on a canal, look elsewhere.
reviews.title: AMAZING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was the best one that we had during our tour of Italy. We were on our honeymoon and booked it using Gate1travel. I saw the amazing reviews on this site and every single one of them was true.
reviews.title: Ritz Carlton-Like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This new hotel is well situated near to the Rialto Bridge and within easy walk of Venice's many attractions. Customer service was excellent; our room had a problem with the electrics and so the management arranged a first class suite at an alternative hotel for one night, and we returned to our room the next day to find a free bottle of wine as a thank you. They even gave us a small gift for my birthday.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent customer service

likes.liked: — location in the centre of Venice

reviews.title: A top rate hotel by any standard
reviews.text: The hotel does not have its own restaurant, but this is not really needed given its location. The roof terrace is nice to sit out on, and the air conditioned rooms are comfortable and roomy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently returned to the US from our 10th anniversary vacation in Italy and wanted to say that the La Commedia was by far the best hotel we stayed during our entire two week trip throughout Italy. The incredibly spacious rooms and superb service were top notch. The daily breakfast was excelent and the caffe served was so good, I've ordered some to be shipped back home. Its location is centrally located near the Rialto bridge which made everything very convienent. We would not hesitate to highly recommend Hotel a La Commedia to fellow travelers.
reviews.title: Thank you Hotel a La Commedia!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a disaster! The entire staff we dealt with at this hotel was both rude and incompetent. The property itself was not bad, but the performance and unprofessional attitude of the staff ruined our stay in Venice. I've stayed at several hotels in this price range in the San Marco area of Venice recently, and this one is by far the worst. I had heard that people had good experiences here in the off season, but the staff clearly can't handle running the place during the peak visitor season of the summer. I will never return here.
reviews.title: Total disaster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked our Venice trip as a suprise for my Husband's 30th Birthday.
reviews.title: Great Stay at La Commedia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had an amazing stay in Venice which we thought was a fabulous city.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Hotel

likes.liked: — Ambience of staying in a small luxury hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was everything all the reviews said - clean, modern, great location and good value for money. I'm so glad I booked this hotel and not some of the others I was originally considering!
reviews.title: Lovely Modern Hotel
Perfect Honeymoon, complete luxury
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed as part of our honeymoon trip to Italy and we loved every minute of our stay to La Commedia. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful and the room that we stayed in was nothing but complete luxury.

reviews.title: fantastic hotel
reviews.text: On our first night we had to move to another hotel due to an electrical probably however it was to an upgraded hotel and on arrival back they upgraded our room and gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne, which went down a complete treat!!

description: Just opened in 2006, Hotel a La Commedia is located in one of the most lively areas of the historical centre a few steps away from Rialto bridge and the most famous San Marco's Square.
